m_szDocTitle: Aberdeen to get UK's first hydrogen-powered car club fleet | EV Fleet World
m_szDocSumamry: News Aberdeen to get UK's first hydrogen-powered car club fleet Co-Wheels will be the first car club to offer PAYG access to hydrogen fuel cell vehicles later this year Aberdeen City Council has bought two Hyundai ix35 FCEV hydrogen fuel cell cars, which will be available through the Co-Wheels car sharing scheme later this year â€“ said to be a first. The cars were part-funded by Transport Scotland and will be fuelled using locally-produced hydrogen, offering a range of 326 miles and short filling times with only water vapour from the exhaust. Promotional events and testing are now underway ahea
